meanings.definition: To make six times as great or as many.
meanings.sent1: She plans to sextuple her savings by the end of the year.
meanings.sent2: The recipe calls for you to sextuple the amount of sugar.
meanings.sent3: Trying to sextuple the number of hours in a day would be quite a challenge!
meanings.sent4: His excitement seemed to sextuple with each passing minute.
meanings.sent5: The magician's hat seemed to sextuple in size as he pulled out more and more rabbits.

meanings.definition: Six times as great or as many.
meanings.sent1: The sextuple amount of balloons filled the room with color.
meanings.sent2: She was amazed by the sextuple number of stars in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The sextuple scoop of ice cream towered over the cone.
meanings.sent4: His voice echoed through the sextuple halls of the empty castle.
meanings.sent5: The sextuple layers of frosting made the cake look like a work of art.

meanings.definition: A group or set of six.
meanings.sent1: The team formed a sextuple to tackle the project together.
meanings.sent2: The dice showed a sextuple of sixes, winning him the game.
meanings.sent3: The sextuple of kittens played together in the yard.
meanings.sent4: The sextuple of trees provided shade on hot summer days.
meanings.sent5: The sextuple of friends always met for coffee on Saturdays.
